intro: Hieracium hospitans, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium hospitans is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
